timeline.bodyText: We use the one from the new snapshot so that the timestamps all match. Do you think we should change that?

timeline.message: Add skew handling logic for snapshotlog

timeline.bodyText: I try to avoid variable names in log messages. Plain language is easier for users and tends to be more descriptive. How about "Invalid update timestamp %s: before last snapshot log entry at %s"?
timeline.author: rdblue

timeline.bodyText:
Rather than wrapping a precondition in an if, it's shorter to add an or:
Preconditions.checkArgument(last == null || lastUpdatedMillis - last.timestampMillis() >= -ONE_MINUTE, ...);
timeline.author: rdblue

replies.bodyText: The issue is that the argument - last.timestampMillis() will be evaluated eagerly and may result in NPE
replies.author: rdsr

replies.bodyText: It shouldn't be evaluated eagerly. Are you sure about that? We use this pattern in other classes without a problem.
replies.author: rdblue

timeline.author: rdblue
